TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit PersonalizationProvider extends System.Configuration.Provider.ProviderBase
Public MustInherit Class PersonalizationProvider Inherits ProviderBase

summary.span: 实现个性化设置提供程序的基本功能。

span.span: Implements the basic functionality for a personalization provider.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 这是定义个性化设置提供程序所需的功能的抽象基类。This is the abstract base class that defines the required functionality of a personalization provider. 个性化设置提供程序加载和存储代表个性化数据实例。A personalization provider both loads and stores personalization data on behalf of a instance. 该基类定义大量的方法; 这些方法的标准行为专门处理与基础数据存储区的这些方法将标记为 abstract。The base class defines standard behavior for a number of methods; only those methods that specifically deal with the underlying data store are marked abstract. 这允许开发人员编写一个自定义提供程序进行交互并将特定的数据存储区中，而无需重新实现使用的标准功能类。This allows a developer to write a custom provider to interact with a specific data store, without needing to re-implement standard functionality used by the class.

block.para:
你可以从派生和提供仅在此类中定义的抽象方法的实现。
You can derive from and provide implementations for only the abstract methods defined in this class.
抽象方法处理专门与保存和加载到物理数据存储，数据和数据存储区管理。
The abstract methods deal specifically with saving and loading data to a physical data store, and with data store administration.
自定义提供程序必须支持的操作区别开来的方式个性化信息数据从数据。
A custom provider must be capable of manipulating personalization information in a manner that distinguishes data from data.
此外，提供程序必须由页以及应用程序分段个性化数据。
Furthermore, a provider must segment personalization data by page as well as by application.
实现紧密耦合的实现因为某些个性化设置提供程序方法返回的实例-派生类。
Implementations of are tightly coupled to implementations of because some personalization provider methods return instances of -derived classes.
为了便于开发的自定义提供程序，基类包括个性化逻辑和直接通过使用的序列化/反序列化逻辑的默认实现类。
To ease development of custom providers, the base class includes a default implementation of the personalization logic and serialization/deserialization logic that is used directly by the class.
因此，创作专门用于不同的数据存储使用自定义提供程序仅需要以下抽象方法实现：
As a result, authoring a custom provider solely for the purpose of working with a different data store only requires implementation of the following abstract methods:
- -此方法需要能够提供的查询参数的数据库中的个性化数据的行数进行计数。 - This method needs to be able to count the number of rows of personalization data in the database for the supplied query parameters.
- -在给定路径和用户名的情况下，此方法从数据库中加载两个二进制大型对象 (Blob): 用于共享的数据，一个用于用户数据的一个 BLOB。 - Given the path and user name, this method loads two binary large objects (BLOBs) from the database: one BLOB for shared data and one for user data.如果你提供的用户名称和路径，则不需要控件，用于访问可以提供的用户名称/路径信息的页信息。If you supply the user name and path, then you do not need the control to access the page information that can provide the user name/path information.
- -在给定路径和用户名的情况下，此方法删除数据库中的相应行。 - Given the path and user name, this method deletes the corresponding row in the database.如果你提供的用户名称和路径，则不需要控件，用于访问可以提供的用户名称/路径信息的页信息。If you supply the user name and path, then you do not need the control to access the page information that can provide the user name/path information.
- -此方法在给定路径和用户名的情况下，将提供的 BLOB 保存到数据库。 - Given the path and user name, this method saves the supplied BLOB to the database.如果你提供的用户名称和路径，则不需要控件，用于访问可以提供的用户名称/路径信息的页信息。If you supply the user name and path, then you do not need the control to access the page information that can provide the user name/path information.在所有这些方法中，如果只提供路径，则指示正在操作页的共享的个性化数据。In all of these methods, if only a path is supplied, that indicates the shared personalization data for the page is being operated upon.如果路径和用户名将传递到方法中，页上的用户个性化数据应得到处理。If both a path and a username are passed to a method, then the user personalization data for the page should be acted upon.情况下，应始终加载指定的路径的共享的数据，并且 （可选） 用户个性化设置的路径应还将数据加载如果用户名不。In the case of , the shared data for the specified path should always be loaded, and optionally the user personalization data for the path should also be loaded if the username is not .其他所有抽象方法用于仅在管理的应用程序中使用，并且不在运行时的 Web 部件基础结构使用。All other abstract methods are intended for use only in administrative applications and are not used by the Web Parts infrastructure at run time.个性化设置提供程序实现的示例，请参阅类。For an example of an implementation of a personalization provider, see the class.

summary.span: 初始化 类的新实例。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 由于这是一个抽象类的构造函数，你必须重写此方法以创建从此类继承的类的实例。Because this is a constructor for an abstract class, you must override this method to create an instance of a class that inherits from this class.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract string ApplicationName { get; set; }
.property instance string ApplicationName
Public MustOverride Property ApplicationName As String
public: abstract property System::String ^ ApplicationName { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

summary.span: 在派生类中重写时，获取或设置为提供程序配置的应用程序的名称。

span.span: When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets the name of the application configured for the provider.

value.span: 为个性化设置提供程序配置的应用程序。

span.span: The application configured for the personalization provider.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果应用程序名称未指定在配置文件中使用[元素的提供程序的 web 部件 （ASP.NET 设置架构） 的个性化](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/51363b49-eafa-4b9c-b9d0-80086b385195)属性的值使用属性。If an application name is not specified in the configuration file using the [providers Element for personalization for webParts (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/51363b49-eafa-4b9c-b9d0-80086b385195) attribute, the value of the property is used. > [!CAUTION] > 因为由提供服务的所有请求使用单个默认个性化设置提供程序实例对象，您可以有多个并发，执行每个正在尝试设置的请求属性值。Because a single, default personalization provider instance is used for all the requests served by an object, you can have multiple requests executing concurrently, each attempting to set the property value. 属性不是线程安全用于多个写操作，并更改属性值可能会导致多个用户的应用程序的意外行为。The property is not thread-safe for multiple writes, and changing the property value can result in unexpected behavior for multiple users of an application. 建议你避免允许用户设置的代码，属性所需除外。It is recommended that you avoid code allowing users to set the property unless required. 设置属性可能是必需的例如，在管理应用程序，用于管理多个应用程序的个性化数据。Setting the property might be required, for example, in an administrative application that manages personalization data for multiple applications.

summary.span: 返回 对象的列表，这些对象表示 Web 部件控件集所使用的已知功能集。

span.span: Returns a list of objects that represent the set of known capabilities used by the Web Parts control set.

returns.span: 一个 ，它表示 Web 部件控件集所使用的已知功能集。

span.span: An that represents the set of known capabilities used by the Web Parts control set.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 目前，此方法返回包含两个功能的列表：和。Currently, this method returns a list containing two capabilities: and . 这些是可以在中定义的默认功能[是为了个性化的 web 部件 （ASP.NET 设置架构） 的授权元素](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/d190d4ff-1445-4ee1-88eb-9737c7aa1434)中的元素[个性化元素为 web 部件 (ASP.NET设置架构）](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/3d77da55-73ce-46ce-97cf-7d2abcaada09)元素[web 部件元素 （ASP.NET 设置架构）](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/90af5acc-5a80-4b39-bba7-74afd06b167c)配置节。These are the default capabilities that can be defined in the [authorization Element for personalization for webParts (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/d190d4ff-1445-4ee1-88eb-9737c7aa1434) element within the [personalization Element for webParts (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/3d77da55-73ce-46ce-97cf-7d2abcaada09) element of the[webParts Element (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/90af5acc-5a80-4b39-bba7-74afd06b167c) configuration section. 如果你选择实现自定义个性化设置基础结构，你可以重写此方法，并定义自己的授权相关的用户功能集。If you choose to implement a custom personalization infrastructure, you can override this method and define your own set of authorization-related user capabilities.

summary.span: 确定初始个性化设置范围应为 还是 范围。

span.span: Determines whether the initial personalization scope should be or scope.

returns.span: 一个 ，它指示当前个性化设置范围是 还是 。

span.span: A indicating whether the current personalization scope is or .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法可确定是否应为当前作用域或，根据给定引用控件和个性化设置的状态已加载从在个性化生命周期的前面部分中的信息。This method determines whether the current scope should be or , given a reference to a control and the personalization state information that has already been loaded from earlier in the personalization life cycle. 通过使用此信息后续个性化设置相关的任务的实例。This information is used by a instance for subsequent personalization-related tasks. 使用以下规则来确定个性化设置作用域：The following rules are used to determine personalization scope: - 作用域最初假定为。Scope is assumed initially to be . - 如果当前正在执行的用户帐户不进行身份验证，将范围设置为。If the currently executing user account is not authenticated, the scope is set to . - 如果当前正在执行的用户帐户进行身份验证，额外的处理会按优先级顺序发生：If the currently executing user account is authenticated, additional processing occurs in order of precedence: - 如果页是在回发的模式下，页面请求包含从页面的上一个呈现的作用域信息。If the page is in postback mode, the page request contains scope information from a previous rendering of the page. 如果该作用域信息指示所使用的作用域，则作用域的计算结果为。If that scope information indicates that scope was used, then the scope evaluates to . - 如果当前正在执行的页发生从另一页传输到它的控件 (例如，如果因调用而发生控制的转移方法; 请注意此特定的检查不会为跨页发送发生)，并且如果以前执行页具有实例，作用域设置的值为`Personalization.Scope`属性与上一实例。If the currently executing page had control transferred to it from another page (for example, if the transfer of control occurred due to calling the method; note that this specific check does not occur for cross-page posting), and if the previously executing page had a instance, the scope is set to the value of the `Personalization.Scope` property from the previous instance. - 如果以前的条件未满足，则作用域的计算结果为的值属性当前控件。If the previous criteria are not met, then the scope evaluates to the value of the property for the current control. 前面的计算之后，和作用域的计算结果为作用域，请包括以下进程：After the previous evaluations have been made, and if the scope evaluates to scope, the following processing occurs: - 如果当前正在执行的用户帐户具有功能，则范围保持设置为。If the currently executing user account has the capability, the scope remains set to . - 如果当前正在执行的用户帐户不具有功能，则作用域将重置为。If the currently executing user account does not have the capability, then the scope is reset to . - 如果前面所有范围计算结果为，此结果存储为当前正在执行的页上的隐藏字段。If the result of all previous scope evaluations is , this result is stored as a hidden field on the currently executing page. 这是凭此页可以重播在后续回发期间的作用域计算的机制。This is the mechanism whereby a page can replay the scope evaluation during subsequent postbacks.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法的默认实现使用中的信息[是为了个性化的 web 部件 （ASP.NET 设置架构） 的授权元素](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/d190d4ff-1445-4ee1-88eb-9737c7aa1434)中的元素[个性化元素的web 部件 （ASP.NET 设置架构）](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/3d77da55-73ce-46ce-97cf-7d2abcaada09)元素[web 部件元素 （ASP.NET 设置架构）](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/90af5acc-5a80-4b39-bba7-74afd06b167c)配置节在 Machine.config 或 Web.config 文件，以确定用户的授权功能。The default implementation of this method consumes the information in the [authorization Element for personalization for webParts (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/d190d4ff-1445-4ee1-88eb-9737c7aa1434) element within the [personalization Element for webParts (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/3d77da55-73ce-46ce-97cf-7d2abcaada09) element of the[webParts Element (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/90af5acc-5a80-4b39-bba7-74afd06b167c) configuration section in the Machine.config or Web.config file to determine a user's authorized capabilities. 字典中的功能将成为成员的返回对象方法，目前包括功能和功能。The capabilities in the dictionary will be members of the object returned by the method, which currently include the capability and the capability.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法是用于查询个性化数据的管理方法的抽象定义。This method is the abstract definition of an administrative method for querying personalization data. 派生的实现应遵循下面所述的逻辑。Derived implementations should follow the logic described below. 受约束的返回的项集`pageIndex`和`pageSize`参数，其中`pageSize`设置要返回的记录数和`pageIndex`设置要返回哪些记录。The set of returned items is constrained by the `pageIndex` and `pageSize` parameters, where `pageSize` sets the number of records to return and `pageIndex` sets which records to return. 例如，`pageIndex`为 0 和`pageSize`25 个，则将返回前 25 个匹配项，而`pageIndex`的 1 和`pageSize`25 个，则会返回匹配项 26-50。For example, a `pageIndex` of 0 and a `pageSize` of 25 would return the first 25 occurrences, while a `pageIndex` of 1 and a `pageSize` of 25 would return occurrences 26-50. 如果你想要检索所有可用的记录，设置`pageIndex`为 0 和`pageSize`到。If you want to retrieve all available records, set `pageIndex` to 0 and `pageSize` to . -派生的对象返回按字母顺序，并按的组合其和属性值，同时以升序。The -derived objects are returned in alphabetical order and sorted by a combination of their and property values, both in ascending order. 此方法将查询通配符字符传递给基础数据存储区。This method passes query wildcard characters to the underlying data store. 当前依赖于每个提供程序处理如星号 （\*）、 百分号 （%） 或下划线 (_) 字符的方式是支持通配符。Support for wildcard characters is currently dependent on how each provider handles characters such as an asterisk (\*), a percent symbol (%), or an underscore (_). 通常情况下，对于符合 SQL 数据存储区中，你可以执行通配符搜索部分路径带有通配符字符开头，结束时，或在搜索字符串文本的中间显示属性。Normally, for SQL-compliant data stores, you can perform a wildcard search on a partial path with the wildcard character appearing at the beginning, the end, or the middle of the search string text in the property. 例如，若要查找以"~/vdir"开头的所有路径属性将设置为"~/vdir%"。For example, to find all paths that start with "~/vdir", the property would be set to "~/vdir%". 同样，对部分用户名通配符搜索可以显示的文本字符串中的任意位置的通配符字符属性。Likewise, a wildcard search on a partial user name could have the wildcard character appear at any point in the text string of the property. 例如，若要查找与"John"开头的所有用户名称参数将如下所示"John %"。For example, to find all user names that start with "John", the parameter would look like "John%". 以下查询限制也适用：The following query constraints apply: - 如果仅`scope`提供，和`query`是`null`或上的所有属性`query`返回`null`或默认值，则指示匹配的所有记录`scope`返回参数。If only `scope` is provided, and `query` is `null` or all the properties on `query` return either `null` or default values, then all records matching the indicated `scope` parameter are returned. - 如果属性不是`null`，返回的记录也是匹配的筛选基于的路径值。If the property is not `null`, the returned records are also filtered based on paths that match the value. - 如果属性不是`null`，返回的记录也是匹配的筛选基于的用户名称属性值。If the property is not `null`, the returned records are also filtered based on user names that match the property value. - 如果属性是否不等于，则返回的记录还筛选以返回与非活动用户关联的那些记录。If the property is not equal to , then the returned records are also filtered to return only those records associated with inactive users. 比较包括记录其中属性小于或等于属性。The comparison includes records where the property is less than or equal to the property. 请注意，此方法不会验证查询参数的组合。Note that this method does not validate combinations of query parameters. 例如，代码可以请求一组共享的范围中的特定用户名称与关联的个性化状态记录。For example, code can request a set of personalization state records associated with a specific user name in the shared scope. 由于用户名不与共享信息相关联，则返回的集合将为空。Because user names are not associated with shared information, the returned collection would be empty. 有可能会返回非空集合的参数组合包括：Parameter combinations that have the potential to return a non-empty collection include: - 与结合使用的作用域属性。 scope in combination with the property. - 作用域中的任意或全部的值组合， ，和属性。 scope in combination with the values for any or all of the , , and properties.

returns.span: 针对指定 参数的基础数据存储区的行数。

span.span: The number of rows in the underlying data store that exist for the specified parameter.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法是用于检索个性化数据的计数的管理方法的抽象定义。This method is the abstract definition of an administrative method for retrieving counts of personalization data. 派生的实现应遵循下面所述的逻辑。Derived implementations should follow the logic described below. 此方法将查询通配符字符传递给基础数据存储区。This method passes query wildcard characters to the underlying data store. 当前依赖于每个提供程序处理如星号 （\*）、 百分号 （%） 或下划线 (_) 字符的方式是支持通配符。Support for wildcard characters is currently dependent on how each provider handles characters such as an asterisk (\*), a percent symbol (%), or an underscore (_). 通常情况下，对于符合 SQL 数据存储区中，你可以执行通配符搜索部分路径带有通配符字符开头，结束时，或在搜索字符串文本的中间显示属性。Normally, for SQL-compliant data stores, you can perform a wildcard search on a partial path with the wildcard character appearing at the beginning, the end, or the middle of the search string text in the property. 例如，若要查找以"~/vdir"开头的所有路径属性将设置为"~/vdir%"。For example, to find all paths that start with "~/vdir", the property would be set to "~/vdir%". 同样，对部分用户名通配符搜索可以显示的文本字符串中的任意位置的通配符字符属性。Likewise, a wildcard search on a partial user name could have the wildcard character appear at any point in the text string of the property. 例如，若要查找与"John"开头的所有用户名称参数将如下所示"John %"。For example, to find all user names that start with "John", the parameter would look like "John%". 以下查询限制也适用：The following query constraints apply: - 如果仅`scope`提供，和`query`是`null`或上的所有属性`query`返回`null`或默认值，则指示匹配的所有记录`scope`参数进行计数。If only `scope` is provided, and `query` is `null` or all the properties on `query` return either `null` or default values, then all records matching the indicated `scope` parameter are counted. - 如果属性不是`null`，计数的记录也是匹配的筛选基于的路径值。If the property is not `null`, the counted records are also filtered based on paths that match the value. - 如果属性不是`null`，计数的记录也是匹配的筛选基于的用户名称属性值。If the property is not `null`, the counted records are also filtered based on user names that match the property value. - 如果属性是否不等于，然后计数的记录还筛选以返回与非活动用户关联的那些记录。If the property is not equal to , then the counted records are also filtered to return only those records associated with inactive users. 比较包括记录其中属性小于或等于属性。The comparison includes records where the property is less than or equal to the property. 请注意，此方法不会验证查询参数的组合。Note that this method does not validate combinations of query parameters. 例如，代码可以请求与共享的范围中的特定用户名称关联的个性化状态记录数。For example, code can request a count of personalization state records associated with a specific user name in the shared scope. 由于用户名不与共享信息相关联，则返回的计数将为零。Because user names are not associated with shared information, the returned count would be zero. 有可能会返回非零计数的参数组合包括：Parameter combinations that have the potential to return a non-zero count include: - 与结合使用的作用域属性。 scope in combination with the property. - 作用域中的任意或全部的值组合， ，和属性。 scope in combination with the values for any or all of the , , and properties.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 派生自的类和实现此方法应使用`webPartManager`， `path`，和`username`参数作为检索关键字。Classes that derive from and implement this method should use the `webPartManager`, `path`, and `username` parameters as retrieval keys. 而不考虑如何将数据存储在数据存储中 （某些数据存储可能会执行某种类型的智能存储），必须返回数据的个性化设置为一组打包的两个数组中的字节数。Regardless of how the data is stored in the data store (some data stores might perform some type of intelligent storage), the personalization data must be returned as a packed set of bytes in two arrays. 返回的数据必须符合以下规则：The returned data must conform to the following rules: - 数据作用域必须始终以返回`sharedDataBlob`参数。The data for the scope must always be returned in the `sharedDataBlob` parameter. - 具体取决于键值，中返回数据`userDataBlob`参数。Depending on the key values, data is returned in the `userDataBlob` parameter. 非`null`值`userName`参数指示还检索数据。A non-`null` value for the `userName` parameter indicates that data should also be retrieved. 派生自的个性化设置提供并实现此方法可以优化与其数据存储区的交互通过检索所有个性化数据在一个往返过程，而不是都检索和在两个数据分隔往返。A personalization provider that derives from and implements this method can optimize interactions with its data store by retrieving all personalization data in one round trip, as opposed to retrieving and data in two separate round trips.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationState LoadPersonalizationState (System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager webPartManager, bool ignoreCurrentUser);

summary.span: 从基础数据存储区加载原始数据，并将该数据转换为 对象。

span.span: Loads the raw data from the underlying data store and converts that data into a object.
A containing personalization data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法是使用的主入口点类来加载个性化数据。This method is the main entry point used by the class to load personalization data. 默认实现将从基础数据存储区中加载原始数据 （在派生的提供程序中实现功能），然后将转换到的原始数据实例。The default implementation loads the raw data from the underlying data store (functionality is implemented in derived providers) and then converts the raw data into a instance. 如果`ignoreCurrentUser`参数是`true`，没有用户名称传递给方法。If the `ignoreCurrentUser` parameter is `true`, no user name is passed to the method. 个性化设置提供程序可以选择将此解释为这意味着使用该唯一个性化状态应从基础数据存储区检索作用域。A personalization provider can choose to interpret this as meaning that only personalization state with a scope should be retrieved from the underlying data store. 当方法执行时，它调用方法，并且有三种类型的状态为正在加载时会出现的反序列化错误。When the method is executing, it calls the method, and there are three types of deserialization errors that can occur as the state is being loaded. 在这些特定错误发生时，不引发任何异常，并且运行状况监视功能而是记录错误事件 (运行状况监视和访问由它创建的日志的信息，请参阅[ASP.NET 运行状况监视概述](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/e003f224-70fe-4cd8-a71a-2dc81e2d7e4c)).When these specific errors occur, no exception is thrown, and the error events are logged instead by the Health Monitoring feature (for information on health monitoring and accessing the logs created by it, see [ASP.NET Health Monitoring Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/e003f224-70fe-4cd8-a71a-2dc81e2d7e4c)). 以下三种方案原因反序列化错误事件写入日志：The following three scenarios cause deserialization error events to be written to the log: - 反序列化使用的字符串的属性类型的尝试失败的。A failed attempt to deserialize a property type that uses a string . - 进行反序列化使用二进制序列化的属性类型的失败的尝试。A failed attempt to deserialize a property type that uses binary serialization. - 类型反序列化属性的尝试失败，因为无法创建类型的实例。A failed attempt to deserialize a property type because an instance of the type cannot be created.

span.span: The is .
The page associated with is .
\- or -
The request associated with the page is .

summary.span: 在派生类中重写时，从基础数据存储区删除原始个性化设置数据。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 派生自的类和实现此方法应使用`webPartManager`， `path`，和`userName`参数作为存储密钥。Classes that derive from and implement this method should use the `webPartManager`, `path`, and `userName` parameters as storage keys. 派生的实现必须修改数据存储，以便有效地删除提供的存储密钥的个性化数据。Derived implementations must modify the data store so that personalization data for supplied storage keys is effectively deleted. 负责派生的实现中有关如何它们以物理方式实现此目的。It is up to the derived implementations as to how they physically accomplish this. 派生的个性化设置提供程序必须能够将基于每个页的个性化数据区分开来。The derived personalization provider must be able to distinguish personalization data on a per-page basis. 此外，对于给定的页的状态，个性化设置提供程序必须能够区分和范围数据。Furthermore, for a given page's state, the personalization provider must be able to distinguish between and scope data. 如果将非`null`提供用户名称，则重置操作都适用于范围; 否则，重置操作应用于作用域。If a non-`null` user name is provided, then the reset operation applies to the scope; otherwise, the reset operation applies to the scope.

The number of rows deleted.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法是删除个性化数据管理方法的抽象定义。This method is the abstract definition of an administrative method for deleting personalization data. 派生的实现应遵循下面所述的逻辑。Derived implementations should follow the logic described below. 此方法不支持任何通配符搜索。No wildcard character searches are supported by this method. 如果个性化设置提供程序公开识别事务的数据存储区中的数据，则此方法应作为单个原子事务执行其操作。If the personalization provider exposes data from a transaction-aware data store, this method should perform its operations as a single atomic transaction. 允许仅以下的参数组合：Only the following combinations of parameters are allowed: - `scope`参数设置，并且所有其他参数设置为`null`。The `scope` parameter is set, and all other parameters are set to `null`. 此组合中删除与由个性化设置作用域关联的所有 Web 部件个性化数据`scope`。This combination deletes all Web Parts personalization data associated with the personalization scope indicated by `scope`. - `scope`参数设置，和`paths`参数包含至少一个值。The `scope` parameter is set, and the `paths` parameter contains at least one value. 此组合中删除指定的路径或中指示的个性化设置范围路径的所有 Web 部件个性化数据`scope`。This combination deletes all Web Parts personalization data for the specified path or paths in the personalization scope indicated by `scope`. - `scope`参数设置为、`paths`参数已设置且只包含一个数值和`usernames`参数包含至少一个值。The `scope` parameter is set to , the `paths` parameter is set and contains only one value, and the `usernames` parameter contains at least one value. 此组合中删除所有用户个性化设置给定路径或多个用户中包含与该键关联的 Web 部件数据`usernames`。This combination deletes all user personalization Web Parts data for the given path that is associated with the user or users contained in `usernames`. - `scope`参数设置为、`paths`参数设置为`null`，和`usernames`参数包含至少一个值。The `scope` parameter is set to , the `paths` parameter is set to `null`, and the `usernames` parameter contains at least one value. 此组合跨所有路径或多个用户中包含与关联中删除所有的每个用户个性化 Web 部件数据`usernames`。This combination deletes all per-user personalization Web Parts data, across all paths, associated with the user or users contained in `usernames`. 参数值的任何其他组合无效，将引发异常。Any other combination of parameter values is invalid and will throw an exception. 具体而言，不允许使用以下两个组合：Specifically, the following two combinations are not allowed: - `usernames`参数不能提供时`scope`设置为。The `usernames` parameter cannot be provided when `scope` is set to . - `paths`参数不能包含多个条目时`usernames`参数不是`null`。The `paths` parameter cannot contain more than one entry when the `usernames` parameter is not `null`. 任何`paths`和`usernames`各自的阵列中包含的参数值必须满足以下的验证规则。Any `paths` and `usernames` parameter values contained within the respective arrays must meet the following validation rules. 如果任何验证规则失败的任何成员的参数数组中，引发异常。If any validation rules fail for any member of the parameter arrays, an exception is thrown. 验证规则是：The validation rules are: - `null` 不允许值。`null` values are not allowed. - 空字符串 ("") 不允许。An empty string ("") is not allowed. 在执行空字符串检查之前，应对剪裁参数。Parameters should be trimmed prior to performing an empty string check. - `usernames`参数不能包含逗号 （，）。The `usernames` parameter cannot contain commas (,). - 长度`paths`参数不能大于 256 个字符，为 SQL 数据库。The length of the `paths` parameter cannot be greater than 256 characters for a SQL database. - 长度`usernames`参数不能大于 256 个字符，为 SQL 数据库。The length of the `usernames` parameter cannot be greater than 256 characters for a SQL database.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法是删除个性化数据管理方法的抽象定义。This method is the abstract definition of an administrative method for deleting personalization data. 请注意，此方法仅影响用户个性化设置数据和不共享的数据。Note that this method affects only user personalization data, and not shared data. 派生的实现应遵循下面所述的逻辑：Derived implementations should follow the logic described below: - `path`参数不能包含通配符字符。The `path` parameter cannot contain wildcard characters. - 如果提供程序公开识别事务的数据存储区中的数据，则此方法应在单个原子事务中执行其操作。If the provider exposes data from a transaction-aware data store, this method should perform its operations in a single atomic transaction. - 如果`path`参数为非`null`，然后仅每用户个性化设置记录与关联`path`将被删除。If the `path` parameter is non-`null`, then only per-user personalization records associated with `path` will be deleted. - 与所示的日期后被视为处于非活动状态的用户相关联的仅每用户个性化设置记录`userInactiveSinceDate`参数将被删除。Only per-user personalization records associated with users that are considered inactive since the date indicated in the `userInactiveSinceDate` parameter will be deleted. 具体而言，记录小于或等于将被删除。Specifically, records where is less than or equal to are deleted. - 如果提供了两个参数，则不会删除这两个约束相匹配的记录。If both parameters are provided, then records that match both constraints are deleted. - `path`参数可以为`null`。The `path` parameter can be `null`. - `path`参数不能为空字符串。The `path` parameter cannot be an empty string. 在执行此检查之前应剪裁它。It should be trimmed prior to performing this check. - 属性不能为 `null`。The property cannot be `null`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法是方法的用于将原始个性化数据保存到基础数据存储区的抽象定义。This method is the abstract definition of the method used for saving raw personalization data to the underlying data store. 派生的实现应使用`webPartManager`， `path`，和`userName`参数作为存储密钥。Derived implementations should use the `webPartManager`, `path`, and `userName` parameters as storage keys. 派生的个性化设置提供程序必须能够将基于每个页的个性化数据区分开来。The derived personalization provider must be able to distinguish personalization data on a per-page basis. 此外，对于给定的页的状态，该提供程序必须能够区分和作用域。Furthermore, for a given page's state, the provider must be able to distinguish between and scope. 如果将非`null`提供用户名称，则`dataBlob`参数处于范围; 否则为`dataBlob`假定参数处于作用域。If a non-`null` user name is provided, then the `dataBlob` parameter is in scope; otherwise, the `dataBlob` parameter is assumed to be in scope.

summary.span: 将个性化设置数据保存到数据存储区中。

span.span: Saves personalization data to a data store.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法是使用的主入口点类以保存个性化数据。This method is the main entry point used by the class to save personalization data. 此方法的默认实现使用的内部实现的方法个性化设置数据打包到字节数组。The default implementation of this method uses the methods of an internal implementation of to pack personalization data into a byte array. 如果打包的结果创建一个空的字节数组 （因为属性提取不导致任何个性化数据），则默认实现调用方法。If the results of this packing create an empty byte array (because property extraction resulted in no personalization data), the default implementation calls the method. 否则，默认实现调用方法。Otherwise, the default implementation calls the method.

span.span: is .

exception.span: 正在保存的 对象与 方法返回的 对象类型不同。

span.span: The object being saved has a different type from the object that was returned by the method.
